news_header: The US Film Academy is delaying the announcement of the 2025 Oscar nominees due to mountain fires affecting the film community.
news_text: The United States Film Academy is honoring a film community impacted by mountain fires, leading to a second delay in announcing the 2025 Oscar nominees, now set for January 23 instead of January 17. The Academy cites emotional reasons for the delay, as many in the film community have lost their homes. Approximately 6,000 members are affected, with at least four board members losing their homes. The Oscars will take place on March 2, hosted by Conan O'Brien, while a televised broadcast will raise funds for fire victims.
